intro: Acer ornatum var. matsumurae, commonly known as the Matsumura maple, is a deciduous tree native to Japan. It is characterized by its elliptical to ovate leaves that turn vibrant shades of red and orange in the fall. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring, followed by winged samaras for seed dispersal. It typically grows to a height of 8–12 meters with a rounded crown. The bark is smooth and grayish-brown, becoming more fissured with age.
